message.content:
cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SE 

The paper proposes a novel two-timescale voltage regulation scheme for distribution grids using a combination of data-driven and physics-based optimization. The use of deep reinforcement learning for configuring shunt capacitors suggests a strong connection to the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also involves optimization techniques, which are commonly found in the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of smart inverters and distributed generation units suggests a connection to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper involves numerical simulations and testing, which are commonly found in the sub-category of cs.SE (Software Engineering).
